title: NDP 2026: Morning of the Show
description: NDP morning. A contractor accidentally ran a script that overwrote the production database. You have 3 hours before the gates open. The backup is 6 hours old. Go.

software-engineer.title: Database Recovery Pipeline
software-engineer.instruction: The production database just got nuked. You need to restore it before 40,000 people show up expecting a working app. Put the recovery steps in the right order. One wrong move and you lose data permanently.

items.label: Immediately stop all write operations to prevent the corrupted data from spreading
Compare the current database state against the backup to see what was lost
Restore from the 6 hour old backup to a staging environment first
Replay the transaction logs from the last 6 hours to recover recent changes
Run validation checks and switch production traffic to the restored database

data-scientist.title: Recover the Lost Analytics
data-scientist.instruction: The overwritten database included 6 hours of user analytics that marketing needs for their NDP social media campaign. The raw event logs still exist in a separate system but they're messy and unprocessed. What's your play?

options.label: Rebuild the full analytics dataset from raw logs. Takes 2 hours but gives marketing complete and accurate data for their campaign.
Use statistical sampling to estimate the lost metrics from a subset of logs. Done in 30 minutes but accuracy drops to about 85%.
Skip recovery entirely and set up enhanced tracking for NDP day itself. The real show data is more valuable than rehearsal week analytics anyway.
Ask marketing to cross reference their social media engagement data with what you can pull from CDN logs. Not perfect but fills the gaps collaboratively.

cloud-engineer.title: Emergency Infrastructure Layout
cloud-engineer.instruction: With the production database down, you need to rebuild the infrastructure fast. Drag each component to where it belongs in the recovery architecture. Area 1 is the first thing to restore, Areas 2 and 3 run in parallel, and Area 4 is the final step.
